required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical, Patient-centered Outcomes and Laser Doppler Flowmetry Using Two Types of SCTG
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical, Patient-centered Outcomes and Laser Doppler Flowmetry Using Double Blade Scalpel (DBS) and De-epithelized (DE) SCTG Associated With Coronally Advanced Flap (CAF): a Split-mouth Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This split-mouth randomized clinical trial compared two different types of subepithelial connective tissue grafts (SCTG) considering clinical parameters and patient-centered outcomes in patients with bilateral RT 1 multiple gingival recessions after 6 months postoperatively. 21 patients with 84 sites were surgically treated with coronally advanced flap (CAF) associated with SCTG harvested by: double blade scalpel (DBS) and de-epithelized (DE) SCTG. Periodontal clinical parameters and aesthetics were evaluated by a calibrated periodontist at baseline and after 6 months. Patient-centered outcomes related to pain/discomfort and aesthetics were assessed with Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) after 7 days and 6 months, respectively. Gingival blood flows were analyzed by Laser Doppler flowmetry (FLD) at baseline and 2, 7 and 14 days postoperatively.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of root coverage based on Recession depth at baseline and after 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Distance in millimeters of cemento-enamel junction (CEJ) to gingival margin measured at the midbuccal aspect of the tooth

secondary_outcome.measure: Variation on: Recession width (RW) comparing baseline measurements to 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Recession width (RW) - Distance im milimeters between interproximal gingival margins of GR with periodontal probe positioned at CEJ

secondary_outcome.measure: Variation on: Probing depth (PD) comparing baseline measurements to 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Distance in millimeters from the gingival margin to the bottom of the gingival sulcus;

secondary_outcome.measure: Variation on: Clinical attachment level (CAL) comparing baseline measurements to 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Distance in millimeters from the CEJ to the bottom of the gingival sulcus;

secondary_outcome.measure: Variation on: Keratinized tissue width (KTW) comparing baseline measurements to 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Distance in millimeters from the gingival margin to the mucogingival junction measured at the midbuccal aspect of the tooth;

secondary_outcome.measure: Variation on: Keratinized tissue thickness (KTT) comparing baseline measurements to 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Determined 1.5 mm apically to gingival margin with an anesthesia needle and a rubber endodontic stop inserted perpendicularly into the soft tissue and measured with a digital caliper (determined in mm).

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain and discomfort- Patient centered outcomes
secondary_outcome.description: Pain and discomfort assessed using Visual Analog Scale: Patients make a mark in a scale between 0 (extreme pain) and 10 (no pain)
Esthetics assessed using Visual Analog Scale: Patients make a mark in a scale between 0 (not satisfied) and 10 (very satisfied)
Esthetics assessed using Visual Analog Scale: an experienced periodontist make a mark in a scale between 0 (not satisfied) and 10 (very satisfied)

other_outcome.description: The Laser Doppler flowmetry (LDF) technique (VMS-LDF2 DUAL CHANNEL- Laser Doppler Blood Flow and Temperature Monitor (Moor instruments- process number-FAPESP 2012/13331-2) was used to evaluate blood flow on the recipient sites. LDF is equipped with a laser diode that emits in the infrared spectrum range (Maximum power - 2.5mW, wavelenghts 785nm±10nm).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- systemically healthy patients between 18 and 70 years
- clinical diagnosis of bilateral multiple gingival recessions, recession type (RT) 1 (Cairo et al. 2011) with at least one gingival recession ≥ 2 mm on each side, including canines and premolars.
Exclusion Criteria:
- abnormal teeth position
- smokers, pregnant or nursing women
- parafunctional habits
- plaque and bleeding indexes (Ainamo & Bay, 1975) above 20%
- previous periodontal surgeries on selected sites.

overall_official.affiliation: Bauru School of Dentistry-University of Sao Paulo

reference.citation: Zuhr O, Bäumer D, Hürzeler M. The addition of soft tissue replacement grafts in plastic periodontal and implant surgery: critical elements in design and execution. J Clin Periodontol. 2014 Apr;41 Suppl 15:S123-42. doi: 10.1111/jcpe.12185. Review.
